name: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
description: Complete CPR training for learning mode
warning: This is for educational purposes only. Always call emergency services first in real situations.
emergency_notes: Only perform CPR if all three are absent

steps.title: Survey the Scene
steps.description: When you arrive at the scene, survey the scene and the environment. Also ask if there is an AED present at the scene.
steps.voice_prompt: Survey the scene and check if it is safe. Ask if there is an A E D available.

steps.title: Check the Patient
steps.description: Always remember to shout and make your voice louder
steps.voice_prompt: Tap the patient's shoulder and shout loudly: Are you okay?
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Make your voice loud and clear to check for response

steps.title: Call Emergency
steps.description: Ask someone to call emergency for you but if you are alone you should call it yourself
steps.voice_prompt: Call emergency services or ask someone nearby to call nine one one.
steps.critical_warning: If alone, call 911 yourself before starting CPR

steps.title: Check Patient
steps.description: Check for the three determining factors such as consciousness, breathing, and pulse
steps.voice_prompt: Check for three things: consciousness, breathing, and pulse. You have 10 seconds.
steps.critical_warning: Complete this check within 10 seconds

steps.title: Quick Note
steps.description: Remember to check all three and only perform CPR to a person without all three
steps.voice_prompt: Only perform C P R if the person has no consciousness, no breathing, and no pulse.
steps.critical_warning: All three must be absent: ✗ Consciousness ✗ Breathing ✗ Pulse

steps.title: If at least one (Breathing, Pulse, Consciousness) is present
steps.description: Remember to not perform CPR because it might be dangerous. Wait for the emergency patiently.
steps.voice_prompt: If the person has breathing, pulse, or consciousness, do NOT perform C P R. Wait for emergency services.
steps.critical_warning: Performing CPR on a responsive person can cause serious harm

steps.title: If all of the checklist is X
steps.description: Introduce yourself as the CPR giver and ask around if there are any relatives of the patient. Ask if the patient has a DNR (If yes, don't perform CPR). Most importantly, ask consent and only perform CPR if consent is given.
steps.voice_prompt: Introduce yourself. Ask if there are relatives present. Check for D N R. Ask for consent to perform C P R.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: DNR means Do Not Resuscitate - you cannot perform CPR if one exists

steps.title: Check Surroundings
steps.description: Survey the scene again and check if it is safe to perform CPR
steps.voice_prompt: Survey the scene one more time. Make sure it is safe to perform C P R.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Your safety comes first - don't perform CPR in dangerous locations

steps.title: Start Performing CPR
steps.description: Always be mindful of your posture because giving CPR could also be dangerous to the one performing it. Make sure to kneel and have a strong posture.
steps.voice_prompt: Kneel beside the patient. Keep your back straight and maintain a strong posture.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Poor posture can cause back injury during prolonged CPR

steps.title: Hand Position
steps.description: Your dominant hand is the one you are more comfortable with.
steps.voice_prompt: Place your dominant hand on the center of the chest. Put your other hand on top and interlock fingers.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Your dominant hand should be on the bottom

steps.title: Shoulder and Elbow Position
steps.description: Make sure to follow the correct posture to give quality chest compressions
steps.voice_prompt: Position your shoulders directly over your hands. Lock your elbows straight.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Locked elbows and shoulders over hands provide maximum compression efficiency

steps.title: Chest Compression
steps.description: Allowing the chest to recoil makes sure the heart can completely refill with blood
steps.voice_prompt: Compress the chest at least 2 inches deep. Push hard and fast at 100 to 120 compressions per minute. Allow full chest recoil between compressions.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Full chest recoil is critical - let the chest rise completely between compressions

steps.title: Rescue Breaths (Optional)
steps.description: This part is optional but if you want to you can.
steps.voice_prompt: After 30 compressions, you may give 2 rescue breaths. This is optional. Hands-only C P R is also effective.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Due to COVID-19, hands-only CPR is recommended for untrained rescuers

steps.title: Check Again After 1 Cycle
steps.description: As per the PHA 2024 update on CPR you need to check all three within 10 seconds
steps.voice_prompt: After one cycle, quickly check consciousness, breathing, and pulse within 10 seconds.
steps.critical_warning: PHA 2024 Update: Check all three factors within 10 seconds

steps.title: If the Person is Now Responsive
steps.description: Stop the CPR and wait for the emergency response
steps.voice_prompt: If the person shows signs of life, stop C P R. Monitor them and wait for emergency services.
steps.critical_warning: Place responsive person in recovery position and monitor breathing

steps.title: If the Person is Still Unresponsive
steps.description: Perform another cycle of chest compressions
steps.voice_prompt: If still unresponsive, continue C P R. Perform another cycle of 30 compressions.
steps.critical_warning: Continue CPR until emergency services arrive or person shows signs of life

steps.title: Two-Person CPR
steps.description: If you have a partner or someone who knows how to perform CPR besides you, make sure that your partner is ready before the end of the 5th compression cycle. The switch should be quick.
steps.voice_prompt: If another trained person is available, switch roles every 5 cycles or 2 minutes to prevent fatigue. Switch quickly in less than 5 seconds.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Rescuer fatigue reduces compression quality - switch regularly

steps.title: If There is an AED Present at the Scene
steps.description: Follow the instructions of the voice in the AED
steps.voice_prompt: If an A E D is available, turn it on immediately. Follow the voice instructions carefully.
steps.critical_warning: AEDs provide step-by-step voice instructions - follow them exactly

steps.title: Take Off the Clothes
steps.description: Before using the AED, take off the upper clothing of the victim
steps.voice_prompt: Remove or cut away clothing from the chest. The chest must be bare and dry.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Dry the chest if wet - AED pads won't stick properly to wet skin

steps.title: Put the Pads
steps.description: Read the instructions on the pads or in the AED and put the pads in the correct places
steps.voice_prompt: Place one pad on the upper right chest. Place the other pad on the lower left chest. Follow the diagram on the pads.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Pads must stick firmly to bare skin - remove chest hair if necessary

steps.title: AED Shock
steps.description: The AED can deliver shocks and if needed, make sure no one touches the body. Shout Clear. Some AED delivers the shock automatically, but some AED needs to be controlled manually to deliver the shock.
steps.voice_prompt: If shock is advised, shout CLEAR and make sure no one is touching the patient. Press the shock button if required.
steps.critical_warning: ⚠️ STAND CLEAR - Never touch the patient during shock delivery

steps.title: Philippine Red Cross Contact Information
steps.voice_prompt: For professional C P R training, contact Philippine Red Cross.
steps.critical_warning: Tip: Get certified! Professional training saves lives
